papers.title: Sequential Cross-Over Trial of ICP-Lowering Drugs
papers.journal: Headache: The Journal of Head & Face Pain
papers.abstract: First head-to-head comparison of 5 IIH medications using telemetric ICP monitoring. Found only modest ICP reductions (2-3 mmHg) with high side effect rates. Amiloride ineffective.

papers.title: Imaging Hallmarks of IIH and Pathogenesis
papers.abstract: Review of neuroimaging features and glymphatic system role in IIH. Novel MRI techniques show disrupted CSF flow dynamics and potential for monitoring treatment response.

papers.title: Clinical Features and Diagnosis of IIH
papers.abstract: Comprehensive review highlighting rising incidence, racial/ethnic disparities, and risk of overdiagnosis. Emphasizes stringent application of diagnostic criteria.

papers.title: Treatment and Monitoring of Idiopathic Intracranial Hypertension
papers.abstract: Reviews management of IIH, highlighting rising incidence due to obesity and potential new treatments. Updated treatment review covering GLP-1 agonists as emerging therapy, growing popularity of venous stenting, and multidisciplinary care approach.

papers.title: Current Understanding of IIH Pathophysiology
papers.abstract: Reframes IIH as systemic metabolic disorder with neuro-endocrine-metabolic signature. Weight loss remains only curative treatment.

papers.title: Bariatric Surgery Effectiveness for IIH
papers.abstract: 97-patient study showing 78% complete symptom remission and significant medication reduction after bariatric surgery. 3-year follow-up demonstrates durable benefits.

papers.title: Venous Stenting Outcomes: Intrinsic vs Extrinsic Stenosis
papers.abstract: Patients with intrinsic stenosis have 81.7% symptom resolution vs 40.6% with extrinsic stenosis. Stenosis type predicts stenting success.

papers.title: Atraumatic Cranial CSF Leaks
papers.abstract: Comprehensive review linking IIH to CSF leak development through skull base thinning. Highlights importance of evaluating CSF leak patients for underlying IIH and emphasizes dual management approach: repair skull base defects and treat IIH to prevent recurrence.

papers.title: Fulminant Idiopathic Intracranial Hypertension-Clinical Characteristics and Continuous Drainage as a Novel Treatment Approach
papers.abstract: Explores continuous drainage treatment for severe IIH cases, showing effectiveness in stabilizing patients with fulminant presentation.

papers.title: Idiopathic Intracranial Hypertension in Pregnancy
papers.abstract: Systematic review of IIH during pregnancy, discussing management strategies and maternal-fetal outcomes.

papers.title: Calcitonin gene-related peptide in newly diagnosed idiopathic intracranial hypertension
papers.journal: The Journal of Headache and Pain
papers.abstract: Investigated CGRP levels in plasma and cerebrospinal fluid of IIH patients, finding no between-group differences in CGRP levels and suggesting further research is needed to understand CGRP's role in IIH headaches.

papers.title: Optical coherence tomography surpasses fundus imaging and intracranial pressure measurement in monitoring idiopathic intracranial hypertension
papers.abstract: Found that RNFL thickness correlated strongly with papilledema grade and could be a more effective monitoring technique for IIH than traditional methods.

papers.title: Clinical indications and patient outcomes of intracranial venous sinus stenting
papers.abstract: Reviewed 27 clinical indications for venous sinus stenting, demonstrating wider clinical utility and therapeutic potential beyond overt IIH.

papers.title: Comparison of bariatric surgery and community weight management for idiopathic intracranial hypertension
papers.abstract: Compares bariatric surgery versus conventional weight management for IIH treatment, evaluating effectiveness of different weight loss approaches.

papers.title: Increased brain volume in idiopathic intracranial hypertension
papers.abstract: Explores brain volume differences in IIH patients, providing insights into structural changes associated with the condition.

papers.title: Review of the lumbar infusion test use in pediatric populations
papers.abstract: Reviewed lumbar infusion test (LIT) in pediatric patients. Most studies were for predicting shunt responsiveness in hydrocephalus and IIH. Recommended standardizing protocols and focusing on signal characteristics.

papers.title: Real time intravascular ultrasound evaluation and stent selection for cerebral venous sinus stenosis
papers.abstract: Used intravascular ultrasound (IVUS) to evaluate and select stents for cerebral venous sinus stenosis, providing real-time guidance for optimal stent selection.

papers.title: The clinical characteristics, treatment and prognosis differences between occipital brain tumors with venous flow obstruction and occipital brain tumors without venous flow obstruction
papers.abstract: Patients with occipital tumors may present with symptoms similar to PTC secondary to venous drainage obstruction. Early multi-disciplinary treatment may lead to better results.

papers.title: Efficacy of Tirzepatide Dual GIP/GLP-1 Receptor Agonist in Patients With Idiopathic Intracranial Hypertension. A Real-World Propensity Score-Matched Study
papers.abstract: Real-world study demonstrating efficacy of tirzepatide, a dual GIP/GLP-1 receptor agonist, in IIH patients using propensity score matching.

papers.title: Liraglutide for idiopathic intracranial hypertension: a real-world propensity score-matched study
papers.abstract: Propensity score-matched study showing effectiveness of liraglutide (GLP-1 agonist) for IIH treatment in real-world clinical practice.

papers.title: Non-invasive assessment of intracranial compliance in idiopathic intracranial hypertension: an MRI-ICP study
papers.abstract: Novel MRI-based method for non-invasive assessment of intracranial compliance in IIH, correlating with invasive ICP measurements.

papers.title: A randomized sequential cross-over trial evaluating five purportedly ICP-lowering drugs in idiopathic intracranial hypertension
papers.abstract: Sequential cross-over trial comparing acetazolamide, topiramate, zonisamide, furosemide, and amiloride using telemetric ICP monitoring. Found modest ICP reductions with significant side effects.

papers.title: Nationwide Prevalence and Geographic Variation of Idiopathic Intracranial Hypertension among Women in the United States
papers.abstract: Large-scale epidemiological study revealing geographic variation in IIH prevalence among women across the United States, identifying regional hotspots.

papers.title: Special Considerations in the Treatment of Idiopathic Intracranial Hypertension
papers.abstract: Comprehensive review of special treatment considerations in IIH including pregnancy, pediatric cases, and treatment-resistant disease.

papers.title: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Signs of Idiopathic Intracranial Hypertension
papers.abstract: Systematic evaluation of MRI signs in IIH, establishing diagnostic criteria and sensitivity/specificity of various imaging markers.

papers.title: The Jugular Hypothesis
papers.abstract: Proposes internal jugular vein abnormalities as central IIH driver. Chronic IJV outflow impairment leads to venous hypertension and impaired CSF absorption.

papers.title: Additive Value of MRI in IIH Diagnosis
papers.abstract: External validation of diagnostic criteria incorporating MRI findings. '2 out of 3' rule (papilledema, elevated LP, or ≥3 MRI signs) improves diagnostic accuracy.

papers.title: Venous Stenting vs Shunting: Long-term Outcomes
papers.abstract: Headache recurrence 60% with shunts vs 31% with stents. VSS shows 76% reduction in odds of headache recurrence and lower revision rates.

papers.title: Venous Stenting Meta-Analysis
papers.abstract: Analysis of 1,028 patients showing 94% papilledema improvement and superior safety profile vs shunt procedures. VSS procedures increased 80% annually.

papers.title: Bariatric Surgery Long-term Outcomes
papers.abstract: 97-patient study showing 78% complete symptom remission and 91% reduction in acetazolamide use at 2 years post-bariatric surgery.

papers.title: OCT Advantages and Pitfalls
papers.abstract: Comprehensive review of OCT best practices, addressing limitations and integration with clinical assessment for optimal IIH monitoring.

papers.title: Comprehensive IIH Review
papers.abstract: State-of-the-art review covering pathophysiology advances, updated diagnostic criteria, and latest treatment innovations including novel therapeutic directions.

papers.title: Clinical outcomes of bariatric surgery in patients with obesity and idiopathic intracranial hypertension
papers.abstract: Multi-center study demonstrating effectiveness of bariatric surgery in IIH patients with obesity, showing sustained improvements in symptoms and reduced medication requirements.

papers.title: Metabolic Dysfunction in New-Onset Idiopathic Intracranial Hypertension: Identification of Novel Biomarkers
papers.abstract: Identified novel metabolic biomarkers in new-onset IIH, revealing specific metabolic dysfunction patterns that could aid in diagnosis and treatment targeting.

papers.title: Effectiveness of optic nerve sheath fenestration in preserving vision in idiopathic intracranial hypertension: an updated meta-analysis and systematic review
papers.abstract: Updated meta-analysis of optic nerve sheath fenestration outcomes, showing high success rates in vision preservation for IIH patients with severe papilledema.
